1.verse: Preface of the Redactor -Chapter 1 -The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David king of Israel:

2.verse: Designed to enable people to appreciate wisdom and disciplineand to comprehend words that foster insight,

3.verse: to acquire instruction in upright conduct,righteousness, justice, and honesty,

4.verse: so that prudence may be imparted to the simple,and the young may gain knowledge and discretion.

5.verse: By listening to them the wise will add to their learning,and those gifted with discernment will increase their ability

6.verse: to perceive the meaning of proverbs and obscure sayings,the words of the sages and their riddles.

7.verse: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge;fools are those who despise wisdom and instruction.

8.verse: Give heed, my son, to your father’s instruction,and do not reject your mother’s teaching.

9.verse: They will be a crown of grace for your headand a pendant of honor for your neck.

10.verse: Prologue: Invitation to Wisdom -If Sinners Try To Entice You . . . -My son, if sinners try to entice you,refuse to join them.

11.verse: They may say, “Come and join usas we lie in ambush to shed someone’s blood;let us waylay some innocent man;

12.verse: like the netherworld we can swallow him alive,in his prime like those who go down to the pit.

13.verse: We will discover riches of every sortwith which we can fill our houses;

14.verse: so throw in your lot with usand share in the common purse.”

15.verse: My son, do not accompany them!Do not allow your feet to follow their path!

16.verse: For their feet are rushing headlong to evil;they are hastening to shed blood.

17.verse: It is useless to spread a netif the bird is watching.

18.verse: These men lie in wait for their own bloodand set an ambush against themselves.

19.verse: Such is the fate of all who seek ill-gotten gain;such greed takes away the life of those who acquire it.

20.verse: Wisdom Cries Out Her Message in the Street -Wisdom cries out in the street;she raises her voice in the public squares.

21.verse: She calls out on the crowded street corners;at the city gates she proclaims her message:

22.verse: “How long will you simple people continue to be fools?How long will you mockers delight in your mocking?How long will you fools continue to hate knowledge?

23.verse: If you would seriously consider my reproof,I would pour out my thoughts to youand make my precepts known to you.

24.verse: “However, because you refused to listen to my call,because no one heeded when I stretched out my hand,

25.verse: and because you rejected all my counseland ignored all my warnings,

26.verse: I in my turn will laugh at your distressand mock you when panic overwhelms you,

27.verse: when terror suddenly strikes you like a hurricaneand your doom approaches like a whirlwind,when distress and anguish come upon you.

28.verse: “Then they will cry out to me but I will not answer;they will search for me, but not find me.

29.verse: For they hated knowledgeand chose not to fear the Lord.

30.verse: They refused to accept my adviceand spurned all my warnings.

31.verse: “Now they must eat the fruits of their conductand be glutted with the results of their schemes.

32.verse: For the stubbornness of the simple kills them;fools come to final ruin by their own complacency.

33.verse: But whoever listens to me will be secureand live in peace, without fear of disaster.”

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Wisdom Will Enter into Your Heart -My son, if you take my words to heartand look upon my instructions as a treasure,

2.verse: attuning your ear to wisdomand inclining your heart to understanding,

3.verse: if you cry out for the gift of discernmentand plead for understanding,

4.verse: if you seek for it as for silverand search for it as for buried treasure,

5.verse: then you will understand the fear of the Lordand discover the knowledge of God.

6.verse: For the Lord himself is the one who bestows wisdom;from his mouth come forth knowledge and understanding.

7.verse: He reserves his wisdom for the uprightand is a shield to those who lead blameless lives,

8.verse: for he guards the paths of justiceand keeps watch over the way of his faithful ones.

9.verse: Then you will understand equity and justiceas well as righteousness—every good path.

10.verse: For wisdom will enter your heartand knowledge will delight your soul.

11.verse: Prudence will protect you,and understanding will watch over you.

12.verse: Thus, you will be preserved from the ways of eviland from those whose speech is perverse,

13.verse: who stray far from the straight pathsto walk along roads of darkness,

14.verse: who take pleasure in doing eviland delight in leading perverse lives,

15.verse: whose paths are crookedand whose ways are devious.

16.verse: You will be saved from the wife of another,from the adulteress with her seductive words,

17.verse: who forsakes the partner of her youthand forgets her sacred covenant with God.

18.verse: For her house leads downward to deathand her paths descend to the shades.

19.verse: Anyone who goes to her never returnsor regains the paths of life.

20.verse: Take care, then, that you follow the way of the goodand keep to the paths of the righteous.

21.verse: For the upright will live in the land,and those who are innocent will remain there.

22.verse: However, the wicked will be cut off from the land,and those who are faithless will be uprooted from it.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Blessed Is the Person Who Has Found Wisdom -My son, do not forget my teaching,but cherish my commandments in your heart,

2.verse: for they will bring you length of days,more years of life, and an abundance of prosperity.

3.verse: Do not let kindness and fidelity leave you;fasten them around your neckand inscribe them on the tablet of your heart.

4.verse: Then you will gain favor and a good namein the sight of God and man.

5.verse: Trust wholeheartedly in the Lordrather than relying on your own intelligence.

6.verse: In everything you do, acknowledge him,and he will see that your paths are straight.

7.verse: Do not pride yourself on your own wisdom;fear the Lord and turn your back on evil.

8.verse: This will provide healing for your fleshand restore strength to your body.

9.verse: Honor the Lord with your wealthand with the firstfruits of all your crops.

10.verse: Then your barns will be filled with plenty,and your vats will overflow with new wine.

11.verse: My son, do not ignore the Lord’s disciplineor refuse to accept his rebuke.

12.verse: For the Lord disciplines those whom he loves,just as a father chastises a beloved son.

13.verse: Blessed is the person who has found wisdom,the one who has gained understanding.

14.verse: For she is far more valuable than silver,and her revenue is greater than that of gold.

15.verse: She is more precious than pearls,and nothing that you desire can compare with her.

16.verse: In her right hand is length of days;in her left hand, riches and honor.

17.verse: Her ways are pleasant to follow,and all her paths lead to peace.

18.verse: She is a tree of life to all who embrace her,and blessed are all who hold her fast.

19.verse: By His Wisdom the Lord Laid the Earth’s Foundations -By his wisdom the Lord laid the earth’s foundations;by his understanding he established the heavens.

20.verse: Through his knowledge the depths broke openand the clouds dropped down dew.

21.verse: You Will Proceed on Your Way Securely -My son, without letting them slip out of your sightsafeguard sound wisdom and prudence.

22.verse: They will give life to your souland provide adornment for your neck.

23.verse: Then you will proceed on your way securely,and your feet will avoid stumbling.

24.verse: When you lie down, you will not be afraid,and on your bed your sleep will be sweet.

25.verse: Have no fear of sudden terroror of the destruction that overtakes the wicked.

26.verse: For the Lord will be your assuranceand will keep your feet from the trap.

27.verse: Do not withhold kindness from anyone to whom it is duewhen it is in your power to grant it.

28.verse: Do not say to your neighbor,“Go away and come back again; I will repay you tomorrow,”when you can give him what is owed right then.

29.verse: Do not plot any evil against your neighborwho is living in peace beside you.

30.verse: Do not quarrel with someone without causewhen that person has done you no harm.

31.verse: Do not envy a violent manor choose to emulate any of his ways.

32.verse: For the perverse man is an abomination to the Lordwhose friendship is bestowed only upon the upright.

33.verse: The curse of the Lord falls on the house of the wicked,but he blesses the abode of the righteous.

34.verse: He shows only disdain to those who are scornful,but he showers his kindness on the humble.

35.verse: Glory is the crown given to the wise;fools inherit nothing but disgrace.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -Acquire Wisdom -Listen, my children, to a father’s instruction;pay attention and gain understanding.

2.verse: What I am offering to you is sound advice;do not forsake my teaching.

3.verse: When I was a young boy in my father’s house,tender in years and my mother’s only child,

4.verse: he taught me and said:“Let your heart hold fast to my words;follow my instructions and you will live.

5.verse: “Acquire wisdom and gain understanding;never forget or turn aside from my words.

6.verse: Do not forsake wisdom, and she will preserve you;love her, and she will watch over you.

7.verse: “The beginning of wisdom is: acquire wisdom,and no matter what the cost, acquire understanding.

8.verse: Extol wisdom, and she will exalt you;if you embrace her, she will honor you.

9.verse: She will place on your head a lovely garlandand bestow on you a crown of beauty.”

10.verse: Listen, my son, and take my words to heart,and the years of your life will be multiplied.

11.verse: I have instructed you in the ways of wisdomand led you along the paths of righteousness.

12.verse: When you walk, your steps will be unimpeded,and when you run, you will not stumble.

13.verse: Hold fast to instruction and never let her go;guard her carefully, for she is your life.

14.verse: Do not set foot on the path of the wickedor walk on the road that evildoers follow.

15.verse: Avoid it; do not go by it;turn aside from it and go on your way.

16.verse: For they cannot rest until they have first done wrong;they cannot sleep unless they have made someone stumble.

17.verse: The bread of wickedness is their food,and the wine of violence is their drink.

18.verse: The path of the righteous is like the light of dawn,which increases in brightness to the fullness of day.

19.verse: But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness,and they cannot even see what they have stumbled over.

20.verse: My son, concentrate attentively on my words;pay heed to the instructions I pass on to you.

21.verse: Do not let them slip from your mind;keep them forever in your heart.

22.verse: For they are life to those who find themand provide health to their entire being.

23.verse: Guard your heart with all possible vigilance,for from it flow the wellsprings of life.

24.verse: Turn away from the mouth that deceivesand keep your distance from lips that mislead.

25.verse: Let your eyes look straight ahead;fix your gaze on what lies before you.

26.verse: Ensure that the path you tread is level,and then your ways will be sure.

27.verse: Do not swerve either to the right or to the left;keep your foot far from evil.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Keep Far Away from an Adulteress -My son, pay close attention to my wisdom,and listen carefully to my discernment,

2.verse: so that you may always act prudentlyand your lips may safeguard knowledge.

3.verse: The lips of an adulteress drip with honeyand her mouth is smoother than oil,

4.verse: but in the end she is as bitter as wormwoodand as sharp as a two-edged sword.

5.verse: Her feet go down to death;her steps lead directly to the netherworld.

6.verse: Far from following the path of life,she unknowingly wanders off in different directions.

7.verse: So now, my son, listen to me,and do not stray from the advice that I offer.

8.verse: Keep far away from herand do not go anywhere near the door of her house,

9.verse: lest you turn over your life to othersand your years to one without mercy,

10.verse: lest strangers grow prosperous on your wealthand your arduous toil enrich another man’s house.

11.verse: Then, at the end of your life, you will groanwhen your flesh and your body are consumed.

12.verse: You will say, “Why did I despise disciplineand allow my heart to spurn correction?

13.verse: Why did I fail to heed the voice of my teachersand refuse to listen to my instructors?

14.verse: Now I am at the brink of utter ruinin the midst of the public assembly.”

15.verse: Rejoice in the Wife of Your Youth -Drink the water from your own cistern,fresh water from your own well.

16.verse: Do not allow your springs to overflow,gushing forth water into the streets.

17.verse: Let them be for you aloneand not be shared by strangers.

18.verse: May your fountain be blessed,and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth:

19.verse: a lovely deer, a graceful fawn—let her affection fill you with delightand ever hold you captive.

20.verse: Why then be seduced by another man’s wife, my son,and succumb to the embraces of an adulteress?

21.verse: For each man’s ways are observed by the Lord,and he examines each man’s paths.

22.verse: The wicked man will be ensnared by his own iniquitiesand held fast in the bonds of his sins.

23.verse: He will perish for lack of discipline,condemned by his own excessive folly.

1.verse: Four Recommendations -Chapter 6 -Do Not Take on Impossible Tasks -My son, if you have guaranteed the debt of your neighboror the bond of a stranger,

2.verse: you have been trapped by the utterance of your lips,ensnared by the words of your mouth.

3.verse: To extricate yourself from this situation,this is what you must do, my son.Since you have fallen into his power,go directly to your neighbor and plead with him.

4.verse: Give your eyes no sleep,your eyelids no slumber.

5.verse: Break free like a gazelle from a trapor like a bird from the grasp of a fowler.

6.verse: Contemplate the Ant, You Sluggard -Contemplate the ant, you sluggard;observe its ways and gain wisdom.

7.verse: Even though it has no chief,no governor or ruler,

8.verse: it stores its provisions throughout the summerand gathers its food at the time of harvest.

9.verse: How long do you intend to lie there, you sluggard?When will you rise from your sleep?

10.verse: A little sleep, a little slumber,a little folding of the arms to rest,

11.verse: and poverty will overtake you like a robber,and scarcity like an armed man.

12.verse: Portrait of a Scoundrel -A scoundrel, a villainous man, is hewho specializes in crooked talk.

13.verse: He winks with his eyes,gives signals with his feet,and makes gestures with his fingers.

14.verse: His perverted heart is ever bent toward devising evilas he constantly sows discord.

15.verse: Therefore, disaster will strike him suddenly;in an instant he will be crushed beyond recovery.

16.verse: Six Things That the Lord Hates -There are six things that the Lord hates,seven that are abhorrent to him:

17.verse: haughty eyes, a lying tongue,hands that shed innocent blood,

18.verse: a heart that devises wicked schemes,feet that are quick to rush into evil,

19.verse: a false witness who spews out lies,and one who sows dissension among brothers.

20.verse: The Wiles of a Seductress -Observe your father’s command, my son,and do not reject your mother’s teaching.

21.verse: Bind them forever in your heart;tie them around your neck.

22.verse: When you walk, they will guide you;when you lie down, they will watch over you;when you awaken, they will instruct you.

23.verse: For this command is a lamp, this teaching is a light,and the corrections of discipline point the way to life,

24.verse: to preserve you from an immoral woman,from the seductive tongue of an adulteress.

25.verse: Do not lust after her beauty in your heartor allow her to entice you with her eyes.

26.verse: For if a prostitute seeks a loaf of bread,the adulteress endangers your very life.

27.verse: Can a man kindle a fire in his bosomwithout burning his clothes?

28.verse: Or can a man walk on red-hot coalswithout scorching his feet?

29.verse: So it is with the manwho consorts with his neighbor’s wife;no one who touches her will escape punishment.

30.verse: People attach little blame to a thiefif he steals only to satisfy his hunger.

31.verse: However, once caught, he must pay back sevenfoldand hand over all his household possessions.

32.verse: But the one who commits adultery lacks sense;only someone who wants to destroy himself does so.

33.verse: He will get nothing but beatings and contempt,and his disgrace will never be wiped away.

34.verse: For jealousy inflames a husband’s anger,and he will be merciless in taking revenge.

35.verse: He will not consider any compensation,and he will reject even the most lavish gifts.

1.verse: Chapter 7 -My son, keep my wordsand make my commands your treasure.

2.verse: Follow my precepts, and you will live;keep my teachings as the apple of your eye.

3.verse: Bind them to your fingers;inscribe them on the tablet of your heart.

4.verse: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”and regard understanding as your friend,

5.verse: so that they may keep you from another’s wife,from the adulteress with her seductive words.

6.verse: While standing at the window of my houseI looked out through my lattice,

7.verse: and as I glanced at the immature youths,I observed among the simple onesa lad with no sense.

8.verse: He walked along the street near her cornerand then turned in the direction near her house,

9.verse: at twilight, as the day was fading,at dusk when the night grows dark.

10.verse: Then a woman came forth to meet him,dressed like a prostitute with a scheming heart.

11.verse: She was loud-mouthed and brazen,one who is never content to rest at home,

12.verse: always on the streets or the public squares,lying in wait at every corner.

13.verse: She caught him and kissed him,and brazenly said to him:

14.verse: “I had to make sacrificial peace offerings,and I have fulfilled my vows today.

15.verse: And so I came out to meet you,to look for you, and now I have found you.

16.verse: I have spread coverlets over my bed,covered sheets of Egyptian linen.

17.verse: “I have perfumed my bedwith myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.verse: Come, let us take our fill of love till morning,abandoning ourselves to a feast of love.

19.verse: For my husband is not at home;he is away on a long journey.

20.verse: He took a bag of money with himand will not be back until the moon is full.”

21.verse: With her persistent urging she persuaded him,luring him astray with her seductive words.

22.verse: Bemused, he followed her,like an ox being led to the slaughter,like a stag stepping into a noose,

23.verse: until an arrow pierces its liver,like a bird rushing into a snare,not realizing its life is at stake.

24.verse: So now, my son, listen to meand be attentive to what I have to say.

25.verse: Do not let your heart stray into her waysor wander into her paths.

26.verse: For many are those she has led to death;her victims are beyond number.

27.verse: Her house is the pathway to the netherworld,the descent to the chambers of death.

1.verse: Chapter 8 -Wisdom Reenters the Scene -Does Wisdom not call?Does Understanding not lift up her voice?

2.verse: On the heights, by the wayside,at the crossroads—she takes her stand;

3.verse: by the gates leading into the city,at the roads of access she cries out:

4.verse: “I call out to you, O men;my appeal is to the sons of men.

5.verse: You who are simple, acquire prudence;you who are foolish, acquire understanding.

6.verse: Listen, for I speak of important matters;what I proclaim is honest and right.

7.verse: For my mouth proclaims the truth;wickedness is abhorrent to my lips.

8.verse: “All the words of my mouth are upright;not a single word is false or crooked.

9.verse: All of them are clear to those who are intelligentand right to those who have acquired knowledge.

10.verse: Choose my instruction rather than silverand knowledge instead of pure gold.

11.verse: For Wisdom is better than pearls,and no object of desire can compare with her.

12.verse: “I, Wisdom, dwell with prudence,and I possess knowledge and discretion.

13.verse: The fear of the Lord implies hatred of evil;I hate pride and arrogance,evil ways and perverse speech.

14.verse: From me issue forth counsel and prudence;insight and strength are mine.

15.verse: Through me kings reign,and rulers decree what is just.

16.verse: By me princes and nobles rule,all those who govern rightly.

17.verse: “I love those who love me,and those who diligently seek me will find me.

18.verse: With me are riches and honor,enduring wealth and prosperity.

19.verse: My fruit is better than the finest gold,and what I yield surpasses pure silver.

20.verse: I walk on the way of righteousness,along the paths of justice,

21.verse: bestowing wealth on those who love meand heaping up their treasuries.

22.verse: By the Side of the God of the Origins -“The Lord created me as the firstborn of his ways,before the oldest of his works.

23.verse: I was established in the earliest times,at the beginning, before the earth.

24.verse: I was brought forth when there were no ocean depths,when there were no springs overflowing with water.

25.verse: Before the mountains had been shaped,before the hills, I was brought forth,

26.verse: when he had not yet made the earth and the fieldsor the mass of the world’s soil.

27.verse: “When he set the heavens in place, I was there,when he designated where the ocean and the horizon meet,

28.verse: when he fixed the canopy of the clouds aboveand limited the fountains of the deep,

29.verse: when he assigned the boundaries of the seaso that the waters would not transgress his command,and when he established the foundations of the earth,

30.verse: then I was beside him as a master craftsman,and I was his delight day after day,exulting in his presence continually,

31.verse: rejoicing in his inhabited worldand delighting in the children of men.

32.verse: “So now, my sons, listen to me;blessed are those who keep my ways.

33.verse: Listen to instruction and gain wisdom;do not reject it.

34.verse: Blessed is the one who listens to me,who keeps watch daily at my gates,waiting at my doorway.

35.verse: For whoever finds me finds lifeand receives favor from the Lord.

36.verse: But whoever sins against me harms himself,and all who hate me love death.”

1.verse: Wisdom and Folly -Chapter 9 -At God’s Banquet -Wisdom has built her house;she has hewn her seven pillars.

2.verse: She has slain her animals and mixed her wine,and she has spread her table.

3.verse: She has sent forth her maidservantsand proclaimed from the heights of the city,

4.verse: “Let those who are simple turn in here.”To the person without understanding she says,

5.verse: “Come and partake of my food,and taste the wine that I have prepared!

6.verse: Abandon foolishness so that you may live;walk in the way of understanding.

7.verse: A Parenthesis about the Arrogant -“If you correct an arrogant man, you invite insults;if you rebuke a wicked man, you incur abuse.

8.verse: If you reprove an insolent man, he will hate you;if you reprove a wise man, he will love you.

9.verse: Instruct a wise man, and he will become wiser still;teach a righteous man, and he will advance in learning.

10.verse: “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

11.verse: For by me your days will be multiplied,and years will be added to your life.

12.verse: If you are wise, it is to your advantage;if you are arrogant, you alone will bear the blame.”

13.verse: Folly Sits at the Door of Her House -The woman Folly acts impulsively;she is undisciplined and lacking in knowledge.

14.verse: She sits at the door of her house,upon a seat commanding the city,

15.verse: calling out to the passers-bywho are hurrying on their straight way,

16.verse: “You who are simple, turn in here.”To the fool she says,

17.verse: “Stolen water is sweet,and bread eaten in secret tastes good.”

18.verse: But little does he know that the dead are thereand that her guests are headed for the netherworld.

1.verse: The Proverbs of Solomon -Chapter 10 -The One Who Leads an Honest Life . . . -The Proverbs of Solomon:A wise son brings joy to his father,but a foolish son gives grief to his mother.

2.verse: Treasures obtained by wicked means profit nothing,but a righteous life brings delivery from death.

3.verse: The Lord will not allow the righteous to go hungry,but he foils the craving of the wicked.

4.verse: Idle hands ensure poverty,but the hands of the diligent bring riches.

5.verse: A son who gathers the crops during the summer is wise,but a son who sleeps at harvest-time is shameful.

6.verse: Blessings are showered on the head of the righteous,but sorrow will cover the face of the wicked.

7.verse: The righteous is remembered with blessings,but the name of the wicked fades away.

8.verse: A wise man will heed commandments,but a babbling fool will come to grief.

9.verse: Anyone who leads an honorable life walks in safety,but whoever pursues wicked ways will be found out.

10.verse: Anyone who winks with the eye causes trouble,but the one who rebukes promotes peace.

11.verse: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,but the mouth of the wicked is filled with violence.

12.verse: Hatred stirs up strife,but love overlooks all offenses.

13.verse: Wisdom is found on the lips of one who has understanding,but a rod is in store for the back of a fool.

14.verse: Wise men store up knowledge,but the mouth of a fool precipitates ruin.

15.verse: The wealth of the rich man is his stronghold;the poverty of the lowly is his undoing.

16.verse: The reward of the righteous leads to life;the gains of the wicked lead to sin.

17.verse: Whoever heeds admonition is on the path to life,but anyone who rejects correction goes astray.

18.verse: Lying lips conceal hatred,and anyone who slanders another is a fool.

19.verse: Where many words are spoken, sin is not absent,but whoever restrains his tongue is prudent.

20.verse: The tongue of the just man is like pure silver;the heart of the wicked is without worth.

21.verse: The lips of the righteous nourish many,but fools die for lack of sense.

22.verse: The blessing of the Lord is what brings wealth,and our toil adds nothing to it.

23.verse: Doing wrong affords pleasure to the fool,but wisdom is a delight to an intelligent man.

24.verse: What the wicked man fears catches up with him,but what the righteous man desires is granted.

25.verse: When the storm ends, the wicked man is no more,but the righteous man stands firm forever.

26.verse: Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,so is the sluggard to those he serves.

27.verse: The fear of the Lord prolongs life,but the years of the wicked are cut short.

28.verse: The hope of the righteous brings them joy,but the expectations of the wicked are frustrated.

29.verse: The way of the Lord is a stronghold for the upright,but destruction for evildoers.

30.verse: The righteous man will never be destroyed,but the wicked will not remain in the land.

31.verse: The mouth of the righteous dispenses wisdom,but the perverse tongue will be cut off.

32.verse: The lips of the righteous utter words of kindness,but the mouth of the wicked knows only how to pervert.

1.verse: Chapter 11 -The Fruit of the Righteous . . . -False scales are an abomination to the Lord,but a true weight is pleasing to him.

2.verse: When pride is nurtured, disgrace soon follows,but wisdom is the hallmark of the humble.

3.verse: The upright are guarded by their integrity;the treacherous are destroyed by their own duplicity.

4.verse: Riches will be of no avail on the day of wrath,but righteousness delivers from death.

5.verse: The virtue of the honest man keeps his way straight,whereas the evil man falls as a result of his wickedness.

6.verse: The righteousness of the upright saves them,but the treacherous are trapped by their own schemes.

7.verse: When a wicked man dies, all his expectations die with him,and the hope he placed in his riches comes to nought.

8.verse: The righteous man escapes affliction,and the wicked man incurs it instead.

9.verse: With his mouth the godless man seeks to ruin his neighbor,but knowledge enables the righteous to be delivered.

10.verse: The city rejoices when the upright prosper,and when the wicked are ruined, there is exultation.

11.verse: Through the blessing of the righteous a city is raised,but it is destroyed by the mouth of the wicked.

12.verse: A man who lacks sense belittles a neighbor,but an intelligent man remains silent.

13.verse: One who gossips reveals secrets,but a trustworthy man keeps things hidden.

14.verse: For lack of leadership a nation collapses;safety is assured with a multitude of advisers.

15.verse: Whoever puts up bail for a stranger will suffer loss,but the one who refuses to do so will be safe.

16.verse: A gracious woman acquires honor,while the woman who hates virtue is covered with shame.Those who are lazy become destitute,but those who are diligent gain wealth.

17.verse: A kind man benefits himself,whereas a cruel man hurts himself.

18.verse: The labors of the wicked man produce little profit,but the one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.

19.verse: Whoever is steadfast in righteousness finds life,but the one who pursues evil is on the road to death.

20.verse: Those with perverse hearts are abhorrent to the Lord,but those whose ways are blameless are dear to him.

21.verse: You need have no fear that the wicked will not be punished,but those who are righteous will escape harm.

22.verse: Like a ring of gold in a pig’s snoutis a beautiful woman without good sense.

23.verse: The righteous desire only what is good;the expectation of the wicked ends in wrath.

24.verse: One man gives lavishly and increases his wealth,while another is tight-fisted and ends up impoverished.

25.verse: A generous person will be enriched;he who refreshes others will also be refreshed.

26.verse: The people curse those who hoard grain,but the one who sells it earns their blessing.

27.verse: Whoever strives for good earns great acclaim,but the one who pursues evil will be afflicted by it.

28.verse: Whoever places his trust in riches will fall,but the righteous will flourish like sprouting leaves.

29.verse: Whoever causes trouble for his family inherits the wind,and a fool will become a servant to the wise man.

30.verse: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,and the wise man wins souls.

31.verse: If the just man receives his deserts on earth,how much more will the wicked and the sinner!

1.verse: Chapter 12 -On the Way of Righteousness -Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,but the one who hates correction is stupid.

2.verse: The good man wins the favor of the Lord,but the malicious man incurs his condemnation.

3.verse: No one earns security by wickedness,but the roots of the righteous will not be shaken.

4.verse: A good wife is her husband’s crown,but one who disgraces him is like decay in his bones.

5.verse: The aims of the righteous are honorable,but the schemes of the wicked are full of deceit.

6.verse: The words of the wicked are snares to shed blood,but those of the upright keep them safe.

7.verse: Once the wicked are overthrown, they are no more,but the house of the righteous remains firm.

8.verse: A man will be praised if he exhibits good sense,but one with a perverse mind is despised.

9.verse: It is better to be a laborer and have food to eatthan to put on airs and have an empty stomach.

10.verse: A righteous person supplies the needs of his animals,but the heart of the wicked is without mercy.

11.verse: One who tills his land has an abundance of food,but he who chases fantasies is a fool.

12.verse: The wicked desire the prey of evil men,but the root of the righteous bears fruit.

13.verse: The wicked man is ensnared by the sin of his lips,but the righteous frees himself from misfortune.

14.verse: An abundance of good things flow from the fruit of one’s lips,and a man’s labor will give him a suitable reward.

15.verse: The fool is convinced of the rightness of his ways,but the man who listens to advice shows wisdom.

16.verse: A fool is quick to show his anger,but a prudent man ignores an insult.

17.verse: A truthful witness is honest in his testimony,but a false witness testifies deceitfully.

18.verse: Thoughtless words wound like a sword thrust,but the tongue of the wise produces healing.

19.verse: Truthful speech endures forever,but deceitful lies last only for a moment.

20.verse: Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil,but those who counsel peace have joy.

21.verse: No harm befalls the righteous,but endless are the misfortunes of the wicked.

22.verse: The Lord abhors lying lips,but he delights in those who are truthful.

23.verse: A prudent man does not flaunt his knowledge,but the heart of fools proclaims their folly.

24.verse: Authority will be granted to the diligent,but the lazy will be enslaved.

25.verse: Anxiety in the human heart weighs it down,but a kind word makes it glad.

26.verse: A righteous man gives good advice to his neighbor,but the way of the wicked leads them astray.

27.verse: A lazy man never reaps a rich harvest,but the diligent man acquires precious wealth.

28.verse: The way of righteousness leads to life,but the way of vengeance leads to death.

1.verse: Chapter 13 -The Light of the Righteous Shines Brightly -A wise son listens to his father’s correction,but a mocker will not accept any rebuke.

2.verse: A good man derives nourishment from the fruit of his words,but one who is treacherous craves violence.

3.verse: He who guards his mouth makes his life secure,but one who talks excessively ensures his own downfall.

4.verse: The idler craves for food and remains unsatisfied,but the appetite of the diligent is fully sated.

5.verse: The righteous man hates words that are deceitful,but the evildoer slanders and defames.

6.verse: Righteousness stands guard over one who is honest,but sin brings about the ruin of the wicked.

7.verse: One man pretends to be rich, yet has nothing;another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth.

8.verse: A wealthy man pays a ransom to save his life;a poor man never has to worry about such threats.

9.verse: The light of the righteous shines brightly,but the lamp of the wicked is extinguished.

10.verse: An ignorant man causes strife by his insolence,but wisdom is found with those who take advice.

11.verse: Wealth hastily acquired will dwindle away,but when amassed little by little, it will increase.

12.verse: Hope deferred sickens the heart,but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.

13.verse: One who refuses to accept advice is headed for destruction,but he who respects a command will be rewarded.

14.verse: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of lifeenabling one to avoid the snares of death.

15.verse: Good sense wins favor,but the way of the faithless leads to their destruction.

16.verse: Every prudent man acts out of knowledge,but a fool proudly parades his folly.

17.verse: An unreliable messenger engenders trouble,but a trustworthy envoy brings healing.

18.verse: Poverty and disgrace befall one who ignores discipline,but one who takes correction is honored.

19.verse: A desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul,while fools regard turning from evil as an abomination.

20.verse: Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise,but he who mingles with fools will suffer harm.

21.verse: Misfortune afflicts the sinful,but good fortune is the reward of the upright.

22.verse: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,but the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the righteous.

23.verse: The fields of the poor may yield much food,but it is stolen from them through injustice.

24.verse: He who spares the rod hates his son,but one who loves his son will take care to discipline him.

25.verse: The righteous man has enough food to appease his hunger,but the belly of the wicked man is empty.

1.verse: Chapter 14 -Righteousness Is a Sign of a Nation’s Greatness -Wisdom builds herself a house,but Folly tears down hers with her own hands.

2.verse: One whose conduct is upright fears the Lord,but one whose paths are crooked despises him.

3.verse: The words of a fool ensure a rod for his back,but the lips of the wise keep them safe.

4.verse: Where there are no oxen, the barn is empty of grain,but abundant crops come through the strength of the ox.

5.verse: A truthful witness does not lie,but a false witness lies incessantly.

6.verse: In vain does a scoffer seek wisdom,but knowledge comes easily to the man of discernment.

7.verse: Do not remain in the presence of a fool,for you will not gain any wisdom there.

8.verse: The prudent possess the wisdom to follow the right way,but the folly of fools misleads them.

9.verse: Fools see no need to atone for guilt,but the upright do so and enjoy God’s favor.

10.verse: The heart knows its own grief best,and no one else can share its joy.

11.verse: The house of the wicked will be destroyed,but the tent of the upright will stand firm.

12.verse: There is a way that seems right to a man,but the end of it leads to death.

13.verse: Even at times of laughter the heart may be sad,and joy may end in grief.

14.verse: The perverse man suffers the consequences of his ways,while a good man reaps what his deeds deserve.

15.verse: A simple man believes everything he hears,but a prudent man carefully considers every step.

16.verse: A wise man is cautious and turns away from evil,but the fool is reckless and shows no restraint.

17.verse: A quick-tempered man acts foolishly,but a prudent man is long-suffering.

18.verse: The simple are adorned with folly,but the prudent have knowledge as their crown.

19.verse: Evil men will bow down before the good,and the wicked will do so at the gates of the righteous.

20.verse: The poor man is disliked even by his neighbor,but one who is wealthy never lacks for friends.

21.verse: Anyone who despises his neighbor is a sinner,but blessed is he who is kind to the poor.

22.verse: Do not those who hatch evil go astray?But those who plan good are loyal and faithful.

23.verse: Diligent labor always yields profit,but idle conversation only leads to poverty.

24.verse: The crown of the wise is their riches;the garland of fools is their folly.

25.verse: A truthful witness saves lives;anyone who utters lies is an impostor.

26.verse: He who fears the Lord provides strong security,and in him one’s children will find a refuge.

27.verse: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of lifeenabling a man to avoid the snares of death.

28.verse: Many subjects ensure the glory of a king,but if his subjects are few, he is of no importance.

29.verse: A patient man shows good sense,but a quick-tempered man displays the height of folly.

30.verse: A tranquil heart gives life to the body,but envy causes the bones to rot.

31.verse: He who oppresses the poor insults their Creator,but the one who is kind to the needy does him honor.

32.verse: The evildoer is undone by his malice,but the upright finds refuge in his integrity.

33.verse: Wisdom finds a home in an understanding heart,but she is not found in the heart of fools.

34.verse: Righteousness is a sign of a nation’s greatness,but sin degrades any people.

35.verse: A king favors a prudent servantbut is angry with a shameful servant.

1.verse: Chapter 15 -The Lord Loves Anyone Whose Goal Is Righteousness -A gentle reply turns away wrath,but a harsh word arouses anger.

2.verse: The tongue of the wise distills knowledge,but the mouth of a fool utters nothing except folly.

3.verse: The eyes of the Lord are everywhere,keeping a close watch on the evil and the good.

4.verse: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life,but an undisciplined tongue crushes the spirit.

5.verse: A fool spurns his father’s correction,but whoever heeds admonition is prudent.

6.verse: In the house of the righteous there is no lack of treasures,but the earnings of the wicked are never secure.

7.verse: The lips of the wise spread knowledge;such is not true of the heart of a fool.

8.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,but he delights in the prayer of the upright.

9.verse: The way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,but he loves anyone whose goal is righteousness.

10.verse: Severe punishment awaits the one who strays from the right path;whoever hates a rebuke will die.

11.verse: The netherworld and the abyss lie open to the Lord;how much more is this true of the human heart.

12.verse: A scoffer does not like to be reproved,and he refuses to consult the wise.

13.verse: A glad heart makes the face cheerful,but anguish of heart breaks one’s spirit.

14.verse: The mind of one who is wise seeks further knowledge,but the mouth of a fool feeds on folly.

15.verse: Every day is wretched for those who are sorrowing,but to one who is cheerful, every day is a perpetual feast.

16.verse: It is better to have a little and fear the Lordthan to possess immense wealth and suffer anguish.

17.verse: Better a dish of herbs served with lovethan a fattened ox accompanied by hatred.

18.verse: An ill-tempered man provokes quarrels,but a patient man quiets dissension.

19.verse: The path of the idler is covered with thorns,but the path of the upright is a broad highway.

20.verse: A wise son is a joy to his father,but a foolish son has no respect for his mother.

21.verse: Folly delights the one without sense,but a man of understanding follows a straight path.

22.verse: Plans miscarry when counsel is lacking,but they succeed when there are many counselors.

23.verse: A man is joyful when he utters apt answers,and even more satisfying is a word in season.

24.verse: The path of life leads upward for the prudent manso that he may escape going down to the netherworld.

25.verse: The Lord tears down the proud man’s house,but he preserves the widow’s boundaries.

26.verse: The Lord abhors the thoughts of the wicked,but he is pleased with the words of the pure.

27.verse: He who is greedy for dishonest gain brings disaster on a house,but he who refuses to accept bribes will have life.

28.verse: The righteous man reflects before answering,but the mouth of the wicked pours out evil.

29.verse: The Lord keeps his distance from the wicked,but he listens to the prayer of the righteous.

30.verse: A kindly glance gives joy to the heart,and good news refreshes the bones.

31.verse: He who accepts saving reproof has lifeand will enjoy the company of the wise.

32.verse: He who rejects correction despises himself,but whoever accepts admonition will gain understanding.

33.verse: The fear of the Lord provides instruction in wisdom,and to be humble is the way to honor.

1.verse: Chapter 16 -A man may make plans in his heart,but the Lord provides the words that his tongue utters.

2.verse: A man’s ways may seem honorable to him,but the Lord weighs his motives.

3.verse: Entrust everything that you do to the Lord,and your plans will turn out to be successful.

4.verse: The Lord has made everything for his own purposes,even the wicked for the day of disaster.

5.verse: The Lord abhors the proud man;be assured that such a man will not go unpunished.

6.verse: Iniquity is expiated by kindness and faithfulness,and by fear of the Lord man turns away from evil.

7.verse: When the Lord is pleased with someone’s conduct.he makes even that man’s enemies friends with him.

8.verse: It is better to have little and be righteousthan to acquire great riches with injustice.

9.verse: A man may plan his own course,but the Lord makes his steps secure.

10.verse: The Justice of Kings -The lips of a king utter inspired oracles;he does not err when he pronounces judgment.

11.verse: Accurate scales and balances belong to the Lord;all the weights in the bag are his concern.

12.verse: Kings regard wrongdoing as abhorrent,for their throne’s foundation depends upon righteousness.

13.verse: Honest speech is the delight of a king,and he loves a man who speaks truthfully.

14.verse: A king’s wrath is like a messenger of death,but one who is wise will appease it.

15.verse: When a king’s face brightens it spells life,and his favor is like a rain shower in spring.

16.verse: The Path of the Upright -It is better to acquire wisdom rather than gold,and more desirable to acquire understanding rather than silver.

17.verse: The path of the upright avoids evil;he who treads carefully preserves his life.

18.verse: Pride goes before disaster,and a haughty spirit goes before a fall.

19.verse: It is better to live humbly among the lowlythan to share plunder with the proud.

20.verse: The one who pays heed to instruction prospers,and blessed is he who trusts in the Lord.

21.verse: A wise man is esteemed for being pleasant,and his friendly words increase his influence.

22.verse: Wisdom is a fountain of life to one who possesses it,but folly is the punishment of fools.

23.verse: A wise man’s heart guides his mouth,and his lips increase learning.

24.verse: Pleasing words are like a honeycomb,sweet to the soul and affording health to the body.

25.verse: Sometimes a path may seem to be right,but in the end it leads to death.

26.verse: The laborer’s appetite works on his behalf,as hunger spurs him on.

27.verse: A scoundrel concocts evil,and his lips are like a scorching fire.

28.verse: A perverse man sows strife,and a tale-bearer destroys close friendships.

29.verse: One who indulges in violence entices his neighborand leads him into evil ways.

30.verse: One who winks his eye is plotting perverse deeds;one who purses his lips is bent on mischief.

31.verse: Gray hair is a crown of glory;it is gained by a righteous life.

32.verse: It is better to be a patient man rather than a warrior,one who controls his temper rather than one who captures a city.

33.verse: The lot is cast into the lap,but the decision comes from the Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 17 -It is better to have a dry crust to eat in peacethan to feast in a house that is filled with strife.

2.verse: A wise servant will rule over an unworthy sonand will share the inheritance as one of the brothers.

3.verse: The crucible is for silver and the furnace is for gold,but it is the Lord who tests the heart.

4.verse: An evildoer listens eagerly to wicked lips,and a liar pays heed to a slanderous tongue.

5.verse: Anyone who mocks the poor insults their Creator;whoever gloats at another’s distress will not go unpunished.

6.verse: Grandchildren are the crown of the aged,and the glory of children is their parents.

7.verse: Fine words are not becoming to a fool,and much less are false words to a noble.

8.verse: A bribe is like a magic stone to one who offers it;wherever he turns, he meets with success.

9.verse: One who forgives a misdeed fosters friendship,but he who divulges it separates good friends.

10.verse: A reproof makes a far greater impression upon a discerning personthan a hundred blows will upon a fool.

11.verse: A wicked man is only interested in fomenting rebellion;hence a cruel messenger will be sent against him.

12.verse: It is better to come upon a bear robbed of her cubsrather than confronting a fool in his folly.

13.verse: One who returns evil for goodwill forever have misfortune in his house.

14.verse: To begin a quarrel is like unleashing a flood;so desist before the quarreling begins.

15.verse: Absolving the wicked and condemning the innocentare both equally abominable to the Lord.

16.verse: Of what advantage is money in the hands of a fool?Can he purchase wisdom if he has no desire to learn?

17.verse: A true friend is one at all times,and a brother is born to render help in time of need.

18.verse: A man without sense gives a pledgeto become surety for a neighbor.

19.verse: One who sows discord enjoys strife,and one who constructs a high threshold invites disaster.

20.verse: One whose heart is perverse will never prosper,and one whose tongue is evil will come to trouble.

21.verse: The father of a fool endures endless sorrowand receives no joy from having begotten him.

22.verse: A cheerful heart is excellent medicine,but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

23.verse: A wicked man conceals a bribe under his cloakto divert the course of justice.

24.verse: A discerning man sets his face toward wisdom,but the eyes of a fool range to the ends of the earth.

25.verse: A foolish son causes grief to his fatherand brings sorrow to the mother who bore him.

26.verse: It is not right to fine the innocentor to flog princes for their integrity.

27.verse: One who uses words sparingly is truly wise;a man of discernment keeps his tongue under control.

28.verse: Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise;if he closes his lips, he is regarded as intelligent.

1.verse: Chapter 18 -The Words of the Mouth -Someone who lives alone seeks only to fulfill his desiresand ignores the advice of others.

2.verse: A fool takes no pleasure in understandingbut only delights in expressing his own opinions.

3.verse: When wickedness comes, it is accompanied by contempt,and with dishonor comes disgrace.

4.verse: The words of the mouth are turbulent waters,but the fountain of wisdom is a flowing brook.

5.verse: It is not right to show partiality to the guiltyor to deprive the innocent of a just judgment.

6.verse: The lips of a fool cause strife,and his mouth provokes a flogging.

7.verse: The mouth of a fool leads to his ruin,and his lips are a snare to his very life.

8.verse: The whispers of a gossiper are tasty morselsthat corrode one’s inner being.

9.verse: Anyone who is lazy in his workis a brother to the man who wages destruction.

10.verse: The name of the Lord is a tower of strength;the upright man runs to it and finds refuge.

11.verse: The wealth of a rich man is his stronghold;he regards it as a high wall that cannot be scaled.

12.verse: A man is haughty until disaster overtakes him,but humility comes before honors.

13.verse: One who answers before listeningexposes his folly and incurs shame.

14.verse: A man’s spirit can manage to endure sickness,but when the spirit is crushed, who can bear it?

15.verse: A discerning mind gains knowledge,and the ears of the wise eagerly seek knowledge.

16.verse: A gift opens doors for the giverand wins him access to the powerful.

17.verse: The one who pleads his case first will seem rightuntil his opponent comes forth to interrogate him.

18.verse: Casting lots can settle disputesand avoid contention between powerful rivals.

19.verse: An offended brother is stronger than a fortress,and quarrels are more difficult to overcome than castle gates.

20.verse: From the fruit of the mouth one’s stomach is filled;contentment is gained from the yield of one’s lips.

21.verse: The tongue has the power over life and death;those who cherish it will enjoy its fruits.

22.verse: One who finds a wife finds happinessand receives favor from the Lord.

23.verse: A poor man uses language of entreaty,but the rich man replies with insults.

24.verse: Some friends can lead us to ruin,but a true friend is closer than a brother.

1.verse: Chapter 19 -Better Poor and Honest than Wealthy and Perverse -It is better to be poor and lead an honest lifethan to be wealthy and perverse in one’s ways.

2.verse: Zeal is useless when not accompanied by knowledge,and acting hastily causes one to stumble.

3.verse: A man’s own folly leads to his ruin,yet it is against the Lord that his heart rages.

4.verse: Wealth attracts many friends,but a poor man’s only friend will desert him.

5.verse: A false witness will not escape punishment,neither will the one who tells lies.

6.verse: Many court the favor of the great,and everyone is a friend to a man who bestows gifts.

7.verse: The poor man is despised by all his brothers;how much more do his friends desert him!He pursues them with entreatiesbut all in vain.

8.verse: Whoever gains wisdom loves his own soul;one who cherishes understanding will prosper.

9.verse: A false witness will not escape punishment,and the one who tells lies will perish.

10.verse: It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury,much less for a slave to rule over princes.

11.verse: A man with good sense is slow to anger,and he earns glory for overlooking an offense.

12.verse: A king’s anger is like the roaring of a lion,but his favor is like dew on the grass.

13.verse: A foolish son is a calamity to his father,and a nagging wife is like an endless dripping of water.

14.verse: A house and wealth are inherited from parents,but a prudent wife is a gift from the Lord.

15.verse: Laziness results in excessive sleep,and an idle man suffers hunger.

16.verse: Whoever observes the commandments will live,but the one who scorns them will die.

17.verse: Whoever is kind to the poor lends to the Lordwho will recompense him for his kindness.

18.verse: Chastise your son while there is still hope for him,but do not allow your anger to cause his death.

19.verse: One with a violent temper must bear the consequences;if you spare him, you make his evil worse.

20.verse: Heed advice and accept instructionso that your wisdom may increase in the future.

21.verse: Many are the plans in a human mind,but it is the purpose of the Lord that will prevail.

22.verse: A man’s attraction is his kindness;it is far better to be poor than to be a liar.

23.verse: The fear of the Lord leads to life,enabling one to eat and sleep without fear of harm.

24.verse: The idler will dip his hand into the dish,but he will not so much as lift it to his mouth.

25.verse: If you strike a scoffer, the simple will learn prudence;if you reprove an intelligent man, he will gain understanding.

26.verse: Anyone who maltreats his father and casts out his motheris a shameful and despicable son.

27.verse: If a son ceases to accept correction,he strays from the words of knowledge.

28.verse: A lying witness makes a mockery of justice,and the mouth of the wicked feasts on iniquity.

29.verse: Punishments were meant for scoffersand flogging for the backs of fools.

1.verse: Chapter 20 -Who Can Find Someone Truly Faithful? -Wine encourages recklessness and strong drink leads to brawls;anyone who allows them to seduce him is not wise.

2.verse: The anger of a king is like the roar of a lion;he who provokes him places his life in jeopardy.

3.verse: It is honorable to avoid strife,but every fool is quarrelsome.

4.verse: The idler does not plow in season;so at harvest-time he looks for a crop in vain.

5.verse: The purpose of a man’s heart is like deep water,but a discerning person will draw it out.

6.verse: Many declare their loyalty,but who can find someone truly faithful?

7.verse: When a man leads a blameless and upright life,blessed are the children who succeed him.

8.verse: A king who is seated on the throne of judgmentwill eradicate all evil with a mere glance.

9.verse: Who can truly say, “I have cleansed my heartand I am purified of all sin”?

10.verse: Weights and measures that are not consistentare an abomination to the Lord.

11.verse: By his very actions a child revealswhether his conduct is innocent and upright.

12.verse: The ear that hears and the eye that sees—the Lord has made both of them.

13.verse: Do not love sleep if you wish to avoid poverty;remain awake and you will never lack food.

14.verse: “No good, no good,” says the buyer,but then he goes forth to boast about his bargain.

15.verse: There is gold or an abundance of costly pearls,but the lips that reveal knowledge are a rare jewel.

16.verse: Take the garment of anyone who becomes surety for a stranger;demand a pledge as security for persons unknown to you.

17.verse: Bread obtained by deceit may taste sweet to a man,but afterward his mouth is filled with grit.

18.verse: Plans will succeed when good advice is accepted;follow wise guidance when waging war.

19.verse: A tale-bearer will reveal secrets;so do not associate with a gossip.

20.verse: If anyone curses his father or mother,his lamp will go out in utter darkness.

21.verse: Possessions that are quickly acquired in the beginningwill not be blessed in the end.

22.verse: Do not say, “I will repay evil,”but trust in the Lord, who will help you.

23.verse: Differing weights are an abomination to the Lord,and dishonest scales are not acceptable to him.

24.verse: A man’s steps are directed by the Lord;how then can anyone understand his own way?

25.verse: It is rash to pledge a sacred gift,or to make a vow and then have second thoughts.

26.verse: A wise king winnows the wickedand requites them for their guilt.

27.verse: The human spirit is the lamp of the Lordthat searches out the innermost self.

28.verse: Loyalty and faithfulness preserve the king,and his throne is founded on saving justice.

29.verse: The glory of youths is their strength,but the splendor of the aged is their gray hair.

30.verse: Evil is cleansed away by blows that wound,and beatings chasten the innermost being.

1.verse: Chapter 21 -The Lord Weighs the Heart -A king’s heart is like a stream of water in the hand of the Lord;he directs it wherever he pleases.

2.verse: A man’s ways may seem right to him,but the Lord weighs the heart.

3.verse: To do what is right and justis more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.

4.verse: Haughty eyes and a proud heart—the lamp of the wicked—are nothing but sin.

5.verse: The plans of the diligent will ensure profit,but rash haste will surely lead to poverty.

6.verse: One who amasses a fortune by means of a lying tongueis pursuing a fleeting vapor that leads to death.

7.verse: The violence of the wicked will sweep them awaybecause they refuse to do what is right.

8.verse: The way of the guilty is crooked,but the conduct of the innocent is straightforward.

9.verse: It is better to live on the corner of a roofthan to share a spacious house with a nagging wife.

10.verse: The soul of the wicked man is intent on evil;his neighbor beholds no pity in his countenance.

11.verse: When the scoffer is punished, the simple become wiser;when the wise man is instructed, he increases in knowledge.

12.verse: The Righteous One watches the house of the evildoerand brings the evildoer to destruction.

13.verse: One who shuts his ears to the cries of the poorwill himself also cry out and not be heard.

14.verse: A gift given secretly appeases anger,and a gift concealed in the cloak will avert violent wrath.

15.verse: When justice is done, the upright rejoice,but evildoers are filled with terror.

16.verse: Anyone who strays from the way of prudencewill rest in the company of the shades.

17.verse: Whoever craves pleasure will end up in want;whoever loves wine and oil will never grow rich.

18.verse: The wicked man serves as a ransom for the righteous,as does the faithless man for the upright.

19.verse: It is better to live alone in the wildernessthan with a nagging and irritable wife.

20.verse: The house of the wise man is filled with precious treasure and oil,but the fool squanders all he has.

21.verse: Whoever pursues righteousness and kindnesswill find life and honor too.

22.verse: A wise man can storm a city of warriorsand overthrow the stronghold upon which they relied.

23.verse: One who guards his mouth and his tonguewill preserve himself from trouble.

24.verse: A scoffer is a proud and insolent manwho is haughty in everything he does.

25.verse: The cravings of the idler will prove fatal,since his hands will do no work.

26.verse: All day long the godless man continues to covet,whereas the righteous man gives unsparingly.

27.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is abhorrent,and more so when it is offered for evil motives.

28.verse: A false witness will perish,but a truthful witness will never be silenced.

29.verse: A wicked man puts up a bold front,but an upright man amends his ways.

30.verse: Neither wisdom nor understanding nor counselcan be of avail against the Lord.

31.verse: The horse is prepared for the day of battle,but victory rests with the Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 22 -Reflections on the Human Condition -An honorable name is more to be desired than great riches,and high esteem is preferable to silver and gold.

2.verse: The rich and the poor have this in common:all of them were made by the Lord.

3.verse: A prudent man perceives danger and seeks shelter,while the simple continue forward and pay for it.

4.verse: The reward of humility and fear of the Lordis wealth, honor, and life.

5.verse: Thorns and snares cover the path of the perverse;whoever values his life will steer clear of them.

6.verse: Train a child in the way he should go,and he will not deviate from it, even in old age.

7.verse: The wealthy man lords it over the poor,and the borrower becomes the slave of the lender.

8.verse: Whoever sows injustice will reap calamity,and the rod of his wrath will disappear.

9.verse: One who is kindly will be blessed,for he shares his food with the poor.

10.verse: Banish the scoffer and strife will cease;discord and abuse will come to an end.

11.verse: The Lord loves the pure of heart;the man of gracious speech will have the king as a friend.

12.verse: The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge,but he ruins the plans of the unfaithful.

13.verse: The idler cries out, “There is a lion outside;I will be killed if I go out on the street.”

14.verse: The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit;the man with whom the Lord is angry will fall into it.

15.verse: Folly is rooted deep in the heart of a child,but the rod of correction will remove it far from him.

16.verse: A man becomes rich by crushing the poor,but presents to the rich will only impoverish him.

17.verse: The Sayings of the Wise -Lend Your Ear -These are the sayings of the wise:Incline your ear and listen to my words,and apply your mind to the knowledge I impart.

18.verse: They will afford pleasure if you keep them in your heartand have all of them ready on your lips.

19.verse: In order that your trust may be in the Lord,I will make them known to you today.

20.verse: Have I not written for you thirty sayingsof admonition and knowledge

21.verse: to show you what is right and trueso that you can offer sound answers to the one who sent you?

22.verse: Practical Counsels -Do not rob the poor because they are helplessor oppress the needy at the gate.

23.verse: For the Lord will take up their causeand rob of life those who despoiled them.

24.verse: Never make friends with a man prone to anger,and do not associate with anyone who is wrathful.

25.verse: Otherwise you may learn his waysand find yourself entangled in a snare.

26.verse: Do not be one of those who give pledgesand become surety for another’s debts.

27.verse: For if you have no means of paying,your bed will be taken from under you.

28.verse: Never remove the ancient boundary stonethat your ancestors set up.

29.verse: If you see a man who is skilled in his work,remember that he will serve kings;he will not stand before common people.

1.verse: Chapter 23 -When You Sit Down To Dine with a Ruler . . . -When you sit down to dine with a ruler,take careful note of what is before you.

2.verse: Control yourselfif you are given to overindulgence.

3.verse: Do not yearn for the ruler’s delicacies,for they are deceptive food.

4.verse: Wealth Passes Away -Do not wear yourself out in the pursuit of wealth,and cease even to think about it.

5.verse: When you fix your gaze upon it,it is gone before you realize it.For it suddenly sprouts wingsand flies up to the sky like an eagle.

6.verse: Do Not Dine with a Stingy Man -Do not dine with a stingy manor hanker for his delicacies.

7.verse: For, like a hair,they will stick in your throat.“Eat and drink,” he will say to you,but he does not mean it in his heart.

8.verse: You will vomit up the little you have eatenand find that your compliments have been wasted.

9.verse: Do not waste your words on a foolwho will only despise the wisdom of your comments.

10.verse: God Vindicates the Defenseless -Do not move an ancient boundary stoneor encroach on the lands of orphans.

11.verse: For their redeemer is powerful,and he will take up their cause against you.

12.verse: Direct Your Heart along the Right Path -Apply your heart to instructionand your ears to words of knowledge.

13.verse: Do not withhold discipline from a child;if you beat him with a rod, he will not die.

14.verse: Rather, if you beat him with a rod,you will save him from the netherworld.

15.verse: My son, if your heart is wise,then my heart will be glad.

16.verse: Also my innermost being will rejoicewhen your lips utter what is right.

17.verse: Do not allow your heart to envy sinners,but always be zealous for the fear of the Lord;

18.verse: there truly is a future for you,and your hope will not be cut short.

19.verse: Listen, my son, and be wiseas you direct your heart along the right path.

20.verse: Do not consort with drunkardsor be one of those who gorge themselves with meat.

21.verse: For the drunkard and the glutton will become impoverished,and stupor will clothe them in rags.

22.verse: Listen to your father who begot you,and do not despise your mother when she is old.

23.verse: Buy truth and do not sell it;this is wisdom, instruction, and understanding.

24.verse: The father of a good man will rejoice;he who begets a wise son will delight in him.

25.verse: May your father and mother be glad;may the one who bore you exult.

26.verse: The Prostitute Is a Deep Well -My son, pay attention to meand let your eyes delight in my ways.

27.verse: For a prostitute is a deep well,and an adulteress is a narrow pit.

28.verse: Such a woman lies in wait like a robber,and many are the men she deludes.

29.verse: The Joys and Dangers of Wine -Who endures misery? Who endures remorse?Who has strife? Who has anxiety?Who becomes bruised without knowing the reason?Who has blackened eyes?

30.verse: Those who linger over their wine too long,those who sample blended wines.

31.verse: Do not note how red the wine is,how it sparkles in the cup,and how smoothly it goes down.

32.verse: For in the end its bite is like that of a serpentor that of a poisonous viper.

33.verse: Then your eyes will behold strange sights,and your heart will utter distorted words.

34.verse: You will become like one sleeping at seaor clinging to the top of the mast.

35.verse: You will say, “They struck me, but I was not hurt.They beat me, but I did not feel it.When will I awaken,so that I can seek another drink?”

1.verse: Chapter 24 -Do Not Be Envious of the Wicked -Do not be envious of the wickedor desire to be in their company.

2.verse: For their hearts scheme of violence,and their lips speak only of mischief.

3.verse: By wisdom a house is built;by understanding it is made secure.

4.verse: By knowledge its rooms are filledwith rare and desirable riches of all kinds.

5.verse: A wise man is mightier than a strong man,and a man of knowledge prevails over one who has strength.

6.verse: For you wage war by wise guidance,and victory depends on a host of counselors.

7.verse: Wisdom is too lofty for a fool;at the city gate he does not open his mouth.

8.verse: Anyone who plans to do evilearns a reputation for intrigue.

9.verse: The intrigues of fools are sinful,and men find the scoffer abhorrent.

10.verse: If you lose heart in time of adversity,your strength will indeed be limited.

11.verse: Rescue those who are being led away to deathand save those who are on their way to execution.

12.verse: If you say, “I do not know this man,”will he who tests the heart not perceive it?He who is the guardian of your soul knows it,and he will repay you as your deeds deserve.

13.verse: Eat honey, my son, for it is good,and the drippings of the honeycomb are sweet to the taste.

14.verse: In much the same mannerwill wisdom be sweet to your soul.If you find it, you will have a future,and your hope will not be cut off.

15.verse: Do not lie in wait at the home of a righteous man;do not raid his dwelling.

16.verse: For a righteous man falls seven times and rises again,but the wicked stumble into calamity.

17.verse: Do not be glad when your enemy falls;when he stumbles, do not let your heart exult,

18.verse: for fear that the Lord will be displeased at the sightand withdraw his wrath from your enemy.

19.verse: Do not become outraged about evildoersor be envious of the wicked.

20.verse: For they will have no tomorrow;the lamp of the wicked will be extinguished.

21.verse: My son, fear the Lord and fear the king;avoid those who rebel against them.

22.verse: For disaster will strike them suddenly,and who knows what ruin will afflict them and their friends?

23.verse: Other Sayings of the Wise -These also are sayings of the wise:To show partiality in judgmentis an invidious act.

24.verse: Whoever says to the wicked, “You are innocent,”will be cursed by peoples and denounced by nations.

25.verse: But those who convict the evildoer will fare well,and they will be blessed with prosperity.

26.verse: Anyone who offers an honest answergives a kiss on the lips.

27.verse: Plan what you want outsideand make everything ready on the land;once you have done this,you can go forth and build your house.

28.verse: Never be a witness against your neighbor without good reasonor deceive with your lips.

29.verse: Never say, “I will do to him as he has done to me;I will pay him back for what he has done.”

30.verse: I Passed by the Field of a Lazy Idler . . . -I passed by the field of a lazy idler,by the vineyard of a man without sense.

31.verse: I saw that it was completely overgrown with thorns;the ground was covered with weeds,and its stone wall was broken down.

32.verse: And as I gazed at it and reflected,I drew this lesson from the sight:

33.verse: a little sleep, a little slumber,a little folding of the arms to rest,

34.verse: and poverty will come upon you like a thief,and want will assail you like an armed warrior.

1.verse: Proverbs of Solomon from the Collection of the Men of Hezekiah -These are some other proverbs of Solomon that were transcribed by the men of King Hezekiah of Judah:

2.verse: Chapter 25 -These are some other proverbs of Solomon that were transcribed by the men of King Hezekiah of Judah:God, the King, and the People -To keep something secret is the glory of God,but to have it searched out is the glory of kings.

3.verse: Like the heavens in height and the earth in depth,the heart of a king is unfathomable.

4.verse: If you remove the dross from silver,it emerges completely purified.

5.verse: If you remove the wicked from the king’s presence,his throne will be founded on righteousness.

6.verse: Do not push yourself forward in the king’s presenceor take a place where the great assemble.

7.verse: For it is better to be told, “Come up closer,”than to be humiliated in the presence of the prince.

8.verse: Observations and Recommendations -What your eyes have witnessed,do not hastily testify to at the trial;for what will you do at the endwhen your neighbor puts you to shame?

9.verse: Argue your case with your neighborbut do not disclose another’s secret,

10.verse: for fear your listener will reproach youand your reputation will be irretrievably damaged.

11.verse: Like apples of gold inlaid with silverare words that are aptly spoken.

12.verse: Like a gold ring or a necklace of fine goldis a wise man’s rebuke to an attentive ear.

13.verse: Like the coolness of snow at the time of harvestis a faithful messenger to those who dispatch him;he revives the spirit of his masters.

14.verse: Like clouds and wind that bring no rainis the one who boasts of gifts that are never given.

15.verse: A ruler may be won over by patience,and a gentle tongue can break bones.

16.verse: If you find honey, eat only enough to satisfy you,for if you consume too much, you will vomit it up.

17.verse: Do not enter too frequently into your neighbor’s houselest he become tired of you and begin to hate you.

18.verse: Like a club or a sword or a keen arrowis one who bears false witness against a neighbor.

19.verse: Like a decaying tooth or a lame footis trust in a faithless man on the day of trouble.

20.verse: Like one who takes away clothing on a cold day,like one who dresses a wound with vinegar,is one who sings songs to a grieving heart.

21.verse: If your enemy is hungry, give him something to eat;if he is thirsty, offer him something to drink.

22.verse: By doing so you will heap fiery coals upon his head,and the Lord will reward you.

23.verse: The north wind produces rain,and a backbiting tongue causes angry looks.

24.verse: It is better to live on the corner of a roofthan to share a spacious house with a nagging wife.

25.verse: Like cold water to a thirsty throatis good news from a distant land.

26.verse: Like a muddy spring or a polluted wellis a righteous man who trembles before the wicked.

27.verse: It is not good to eat too much honey,neither is it honorable to seek one’s own honor.

28.verse: Like a city that has been breached and made defenselessis the man devoid of self-control.

1.verse: Chapter 26 -How To Deal with the Foolish -Like snow in the summer or rain during the harvest,honor does not befit a fool.

2.verse: Like a fluttering sparrow or a swallow in flight,an undeserved curse will never reach home.

3.verse: Use a whip for a horse, a bridle for a donkey,and a stick for the back of fools.

4.verse: Do not reply to a fool in the terms of his follyor you yourself may become a fool like him.

5.verse: Reply to a fool in the terms of his follyor he will consider himself wise.

6.verse: Like cutting off one’s foot or submitting to violenceis sending a message by a fool.

7.verse: Like the legs of a lame man dangling helplesslyis a proverb in the mouth of a fool.

8.verse: Like tying a stone into a slingis the giving of honor to a fool.

9.verse: Like a thorn branch brandished by a drunkardis a proverb in the mouth of a fool.

10.verse: Like an archer who wounds all who pass byis one who hires a fool or a drunkard.

11.verse: As a dog returns to its vomit,so a fool reverts to his folly.

12.verse: Do you know someone who regards himself as wise?There is more hope for a fool than for him.

13.verse: A Portrait of Idlers -The idler says, “There is a lion in the road,a lion in the middle of the street.”

14.verse: As a door turns on its hinges,so does the idler on his bed.

15.verse: One who is lazy will dip his hand into the dish,but he is too lazy to lift it to his mouth.

16.verse: The idler considers himself to be more wisethan seven men who can offer a sensible reply.

17.verse: How Human Relations Are Perverted -Like one who lifts up a stray dog by the earsis he who meddles in another person’s quarrel.

18.verse: Like a madman shooting at randomhis deadly firebrands and arrows,

19.verse: so is the one who deceives his neighborand then says, “I was only joking.”

20.verse: When there is no wood, the fire goes out,and when there is no talebearer, quarreling ceases.

21.verse: Like coal for burning embers and wood for fire,so is a quarrelsome man for kindling strife.

22.verse: The whispers of a gossiper are tasty morselsthat corrode one’s inner being.

23.verse: Like glaze that is spread on earthenwareare smooth lips and a spiteful heart.

24.verse: With his lips an enemy may speak fair words,but deep within he harbors treachery.

25.verse: When he speaks graciously, do not believe him,for seven abominations lurk in his heart.

26.verse: A man may cloak his hatred with guile,but his wickedness will be exposed later in the assembly.

27.verse: Whoever digs a pit will fall into it,and the stone comes back on the one who rolls it.

28.verse: A lying tongue hates its victims,and a flattering mouth causes devastation.

1.verse: Chapter 27 -Dictums about Every Circumstance -Do not boast about tomorrow,for you can never be certain what today may bring.

2.verse: Let another praise you, and not your own mouth;let it come from the lips of someone else and not your own.

3.verse: Stone is heavy and sand is a dead weight,but heavier than both is a fool’s provocation.

4.verse: Wrath is cruel and anger is overwhelming,but who can withstand jealousy?

5.verse: Better is an open rebukethan concealed love.

6.verse: The blows given by a friend are well meant,but the kisses of an enemy are filled with deceit.

7.verse: One whose appetite is sated refuses honey,but to the man who is hungry even bitter food tastes sweet.

8.verse: Like a bird that strays from its nestis anyone who is far away from home.

9.verse: Perfume and incense gladden the heart,and friendship’s sweetness comforts the soul.

10.verse: Do not forsake your friend or the friend of your father,and do not run to your brother’s house when troubles befall you;far better is a friend nearbythan a brother who is far away.

11.verse: Acquire wisdom, my son, and gladden my heart,so that I may rebut anyone who insults me.

12.verse: The prudent man perceives danger and seeks shelter,while the simple continue forward and pay the penalty.

13.verse: Take the garment of anyone who becomes surety for a stranger;demand a pledge for persons unknown to you.

14.verse: If someone blesses his neighbor at dawn with a loud voice,it will be reckoned to him as a curse.

15.verse: A constant dripping on a rainy dayis much like a nagging wife;

16.verse: one might as well try to restrain the wind as to control her,or to pick up oil with one’s fingers.

17.verse: As iron sharpens iron,so a man sharpens the wits of his neighbor.

18.verse: Whoever tends a fig tree eats its fruit,and whoever looks after his master will be honored.

19.verse: Just as water reflects one’s face,so does one human heart reflect another.

20.verse: The netherworld and the abyss are never satisfied;the same is true of human eyes.

21.verse: As silver is tested by a crucible and gold by a furnace,so too is a man tested by the praise he is given.

22.verse: You may use a pestle to pound a fool into a mortar,but his folly will never be driven out of him.

23.verse: Take Good Care of Your Herds -Be aware at all times of the condition of your flocksand take good care of your herds.

24.verse: For riches do not last forever,nor will a crown endure from age to age.

25.verse: When the grass is gone and the aftergrowth appearsand the green growth of the mountains is gathered,

26.verse: the lambs will provide for your clothing,and the goats will give you the price of a field;

27.verse: there will be enough goats’ milkto feed you and your householdand to provide sustenance for your servant girls.

1.verse: Chapter 28 -Two Types of Men -The wicked flee even though no one is pursuing them,but the righteous are as confident as young lions.

2.verse: When a land is in revolt, it has many leaders,but it will enjoy security under a prudent leader.

3.verse: A needy man who oppresses the pooris like a drenching rain that destroys the crops.

4.verse: Those who forsake the law praise the wicked man,but those who observe the law are in constant opposition to him.

5.verse: Evildoers simply cannot comprehend justice,but those who seek the Lord understand it completely.

6.verse: It is far better to be poor and beyond reproachthan to become rich through dishonest means.

7.verse: A wise son obeys the law,but a companion of gluttons shames his father.
