8.verse: Whoever increases his wealth by charging exorbitant interestamasses it for another who will be generous to the poor.

9.verse: When anyone turns a deaf ear to the law,even his prayer is detestable.

10.verse: Whoever tempts the upright into following evil wayswill fall into his own pit,but the blameless will have a good inheritance.

11.verse: The rich man may believe he is wise,but the poor man with discernment will see through him.

12.verse: When the righteous triumph, there is a great celebration,but when the wicked prevail, the people go into hiding.

13.verse: No one who conceals his transgressions will prosper,but one who confesses and renounces them will obtain mercy.

14.verse: Blessed is the man who guards himself against temptation,but anyone who hardens his heart will be overtaken by evil.

15.verse: Like a roaring lion or a bear on the prowlis a wicked man who governs a powerless people.

16.verse: A ruler who lacks sense will oppress his subjects,but one who detests ill-gotten gain will have a long life.

17.verse: Someone guilty of murder will be a fugitive till death;no one should attempt to stop him.

18.verse: Anyone who leads a blameless life will be safe,but whoever follows a crooked path will fall into the pit.

19.verse: One who tills his land will not lack for food,but he who chases fantasies will live in poverty.

20.verse: One who is trustworthy will abound with blessings,but no one who seeks to get rich quickly will go unpunished.

21.verse: To show partiality is never good;a man may do wrong even for a morsel of bread.

22.verse: The miser is in a hurry to get rich,never considering that want may eventually afflict him.

23.verse: Whoever rebukes another will in the end win more thanksthan one who flatters with his tongue.

24.verse: Anyone who robs his father or motherand denies that he has sinnedis no better than a marauding bandit.

25.verse: A greedy person provokes quarrels,but whoever trusts in the Lord will have success.

26.verse: Anyone who trusts in his own wits is a fool,but he whose guide is wisdom will come through safely.

27.verse: No one who gives to the poor will suffer want,but one who closes his eyes to them will get many a curse.

28.verse: When the wicked gain power, people go into hiding,but when the wicked perish, the righteous increase in number.

1.verse: Chapter 29 -One who remains stubborn despite frequent reproofwill suddenly be crushed beyond hope of repair.

2.verse: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice,but they groan when the wicked ascend to power.

3.verse: A man who loves wisdom makes his father glad,but a patron of prostitutes squanders his wealth.

4.verse: By ruling justly a king gives stability to his country,but one who takes bribes causes its downfall.

5.verse: Anyone who flatters his neighboris spreading a net to trip him up.

6.verse: An evildoer is ensnared by his own sin,but an upright man goes forward happily.

7.verse: A righteous man has concern for the condition of the poor,but an evildoer shows no interest in this matter.

8.verse: Scoffers can set a city aflame,but wise men turn away wrath.

9.verse: If a wise man argues with a fool,he will get nowhere whether he rages or laughs.

10.verse: Bloodthirsty men hate one who is blameless,but the upright show concern for him.

11.verse: A fool gives free rein to his anger,but a wise man bides his time and calms it.

12.verse: If a ruler listens to the testimony of liars,all of his officials will adopt evil ways.

13.verse: A poor man and an oppressor have this in common:the Lord gives light to the eyes of both.

14.verse: If a king zealously defends the rights of the poor,his throne will stand firm forever.

15.verse: The rod of correction bestows wisdom,but an unreprimanded youth will bring shame on his mother.

16.verse: When the wicked are in power, sins increase,but the righteous will witness their downfall.

17.verse: If you correct your son, he will give you peace of mindand bring delight to your soul.

18.verse: Without prophecy the people become uncontrollable,but blessed are those who keep the law.

19.verse: Mere words do not suffice to control a servant;even though he understands, he will not obey you.

20.verse: Do you see someone who is too eager to speak?There is more hope for a fool than for him.

21.verse: If you pamper a slave from his childhood,in the end he will prove ungrateful.

22.verse: A bad-tempered man provokes quarrels,and a hothead commits a host of offenses.

23.verse: A man’s pride will bring him low,but lowly souls will rise to honor.

24.verse: The accomplice of a thief is his own enemy,for he hears the curse but refuses to answer.

25.verse: The fear of others will prove to be a snare,but whoever trusts in the Lord is secure.

26.verse: Many seek the favor of a ruler,but it is the Lord who administers justice.

27.verse: A sinful man is abhorrent to the upright,and one who leads a holy life is hated by the wicked.

1.verse: The Sayings of Agur -The sayings of Agur, son of Jakeh, from Massa:This is my statement: I am weary, O God;I am weary, O God, and worn out.

2.verse: Like Job -I count myself among the most stupid of men,and I am bereft of human understanding.

3.verse: I have not learned wisdom,nor do I have any knowledge of the Most Holy One.

4.verse: Who has ever gone up to heaven and come down again?Who has cupped the wind in the hollow of his hands?Who has wrapped the waters in the fold of his garment?Who has established all the boundaries of the earth?What is his name or the name of his son?Do you know it?

5.verse: Every word of God has proved to be true;he is a shield to those who trust in him.

6.verse: Add nothing to his words,lest he reprove you and expose you as a fraud.

7.verse: Like Solomon -Two things I ask of you;do not deny them to me before I die:

8.verse: Keep falsehood and lying far from me;give me neither poverty nor riches,but simply provide me with the food that I need.

9.verse: For if I have too much, I may deny youand say, “Who is the Lord?”And if I am destitute, I may begin to stealand profane the name of my God.

10.verse: People with Neither Faith Nor Law -Do not slander a servant to his master,lest he curse you and you will be held guilty

11.verse: There are those who curse their fathersand do not bless their mothers.

12.verse: They regard themselves as pureand yet have not been cleansed of their filth.

13.verse: They have eyes that are haughtyand glances that reveal their disdain.

14.verse: They have teeth that are swordsand jaws that are knives.They devour the poor of the earthand the needy from among men.

15.verse: VIII: Numerical Proverbs -Insatiable Things -The leech has two daughters,each of whom demands, “Give! Give!”There are three things that are never satisfied,four that never say “Enough!”:

16.verse: The netherworld and the barren womb,the earth that is thirsty for water,and fire that never says “Enough!”

17.verse: Woe to the Wicked Son -The eye that mocks a fatheror shows scorn to an aged motherwill be plucked out by the ravens of the valleyand eaten by the vultures.

18.verse: The Astounding Mystery of Generation -There are three things too wonderful for me to comprehend,four that are beyond my understanding:

19.verse: the way of an eagle in the sky,the way of a snake over a rock,the way of a ship on the high seas,and the way of a man with a maiden.

20.verse: “I Have Done Nothing Wrong” -This is the way of an adulteress:she eats, then wipes her mouthand says, “I have done nothing wrong.”

21.verse: The Insolence of the Newly Successful -There are three things that cause the earth to tremble,indeed four things that it cannot endure:

22.verse: a slave crowned as a king,a fool gorged with food,

23.verse: a hateful woman when she snares a husband,and a servant girl when she supplants her mistress.

24.verse: The Resourceful Little Ones -There are four creatures among the tiniest on the earthwho are nevertheless exceedingly wise:

25.verse: the ants, a species without strength,yet they gather their food in the summer;

26.verse: the rock-badgers, a species without power,yet they make their home in the rocks;

27.verse: the locusts, a species without a king,yet they all march forth in formation;

28.verse: the lizards, a species you can catch in your hands,yet they are found in the palaces of kings.

29.verse: The King, Majestic among Other Animals -There are three creatures that are stately in their stride,four that are stately as they walk:

30.verse: the lion, the mightiest of wild animals,who retreats from nothing;

31.verse: the strutting rooster, the he-goat,and a king at the head of his army.

32.verse: Silence Is Golden, Especially in Time of Anger -If you have been foolish enough to exalt yourselfor if you have devised evil,put your hand over your mouth.

33.verse: For as churning the milk produces curdsand twisting the nose produces blood,so stirring up anger produces strife.

1.verse: The Sayings of Lemuel -Chapter 31 -A Splendid Program for a King -These are the words of Lemuel, king of Massa, which were taught to him by his mother:

2.verse: O my son, O son of my womb,O son of my vows!

3.verse: Do not surrender your vigor to womenor consort with those who cause the ruin of kings.

4.verse: It is not for kings, O Lemuel,not for kings to drink wine,not for princes to crave strong liquor,

5.verse: lest in their stupor they forget what has been decreedand pervert the rights of those who are in distress.

6.verse: Give strong drink to someone about to die,wine to someone in anguish.

7.verse: Let him drink and forget his misfortuneand no longer remember his misery.

8.verse: Speak out for those who cannot speak for themselves,and defend the rights of the destitute.

9.verse: Speak out and pronounce righteous judgments;defend the rights of the wretched and the poor.

10.verse: In Praise of the Valiant Woman or the Perfect Homemaker -Who can find a worthy wife?She is far more precious than pearls.

11.verse: Her husband entrusts his heart to her,for in her he has an unfailing blessing.

12.verse: She works to give him good and not evilall the days of her life.

13.verse: She selects wool and flaxand works with skillful hands.

14.verse: She is like merchant ships,accumulating a store of food from far off.

15.verse: She rises while it is still darkand apportions food for her householdwhile assigning tasks to her servant girls.

16.verse: She carefully chooses a field to purchase,and out of her earnings she plants a vineyard.

17.verse: She girds herself to workand plies her arms with vigor.

18.verse: She ensures that her dealings are profitable;her lamp remains undimmed throughout the night.

19.verse: She sets her hands to the distaff,and her fingers grasp the spindle.

20.verse: She holds out her hands to the poorand opens her arms to the needy.

21.verse: When snow arrives, she has no fear for her household,for all of her servants are warmly clothed.

22.verse: She makes her own bed quiltsand wears fine clothes of linen and purple.

23.verse: Her husband is well respected at the city gatesas he takes his seat with the elders of the land.

24.verse: She weaves linen garments and sells them,and she supplies the merchants with sashes.

25.verse: She is clothed with strength and dignity,and she can afford to laugh at the days to come.

26.verse: When she opens her mouth, wisdom issues forth,and on her tongue is kindly advice.

27.verse: She keeps close watch on the conduct of her household,and she does not eat the bread of idleness.

28.verse: Her children stand up and proclaim her blessed,and her husband joins them in praising her:

29.verse: “Many are the women who have done admirable things,but you outdo them all.”

30.verse: Charm is deceptive and beauty is fleeting,but the woman who fears the Lord is to be praised.

31.verse: Give her a share in what her hands have accomplished,and let her works bring her praise at the city gates.
